revised_title: Quantitative Analysis of Ligand-Receptor Mobility and a New Model for Plasma Membrane Topography
tldr: The authors present a new model for the control of plasma membrane topography, explaining the long-range movement of membrane receptors and ligand-receptor complexes into cap and analogous structures. They use two independent methods, fluorescence recovery after photobleaching (FRAP) and quantitative video intensification microscopy (QUAVIM), to analyze the distribution of Concanavalin A-receptor complexes on cell surfaces. The study provides insights into the molecular mechanisms underlying cell locomotion, capping, and related processes.
